title: ArgumentError in ProfilesController#show
description:
ArgumentError in ProfilesController#show
wrong number of arguments (given 0, expected 1..2)

Error occurs at /Users/tomas/git/projects/ai-jam/app/models/attendance.rb:6:in '<class:Attendance>'

Extracted source (around line #6):
  # Status enum for attendance state
  enum status: {
    attending: 'attending',
    waitlisted: 'waitlisted',
    cancelled: 'cancelled'

Full Stack Trace:
- app/models/attendance.rb:6:in '<class:Attendance>'
- app/models/attendance.rb:1:in '<main>'
- app/models/concerns/profile_visibility.rb:21:in 'ProfileVisibility#shared_events_with'
- app/controllers/profiles_controller.rb:5:in 'ProfilesController#show'
- app/controllers/application_controller.rb:9:in 'ApplicationController#switch_locale'

URL: http://localhost:3000/en/profiles/6
close_reason: Fixed enum syntax - used Rails 8 positional argument format

title: Epic 5: AI-Powered Insights
description:
To provide deep context for proposed topics using Large Language Models.

Includes:
- 5.1 Cached Topic Unfolding: Users can click "Explore" button on topics to see AI-generated breakdown. First result cached globally for all users to see instantly without new API calls

title: JSON::ParserError parsing user interests
description:
Error parsing user interests

JSON::ParserError in JamSessions#show
Showing /Users/tomas/git/projects/ai-jam/app/views/shared/_user_card.html.slim where line #26 raised:

unexpected character: 'Claude' at line 1 column 1

Error at: /Users/tomas/git/projects/ai-jam/app/views/shared/_user_card.html.slim:26
Code: JSON.parse(user.interests).first(3).each do |interest|

Stack Trace:
- app/views/shared/_user_card.html.slim:26
- app/views/jam_sessions/show.html.slim:77
- app/views/jam_sessions/show.html.slim:76
- app/controllers/application_controller.rb:9

Root cause: User.last.interests returns "Claude" (plain string, not JSON)
Expected: JSON array format
close_reason: Fixed by parsing interests once and handling non-JSON strings gracefully

title: Epic 2: Intelligent Onboarding & Privacy
description:
To build a rich member database while strictly protecting personal data until it is contextually relevant.

Includes:
- 2.1 Three-Step Progressive Onboarding: Anonymous users sign up through a flow collecting interests before credentials (Step 1: AI interests/tools, Step 2: Email/Password account, Step 3: Personal/professional bio)
- 2.2 Contextual Profile Privacy: Bio and interests hidden by default, only visible to other attendees of same event after RSVP (Event Unlock feature)

title: Epic 4: Collaborative Programming (The "Jam")
description:
To crowdsource the event agenda through democratic topic proposals and management.

Includes:
- 4.1 Topic Suggestion & Sponsorship: Registered users can suggest topics (Handle, Description, Expected Outcomes) and volunteer to manage/sponsor them
- 4.2 Per-Event Weighted Voting: Each registered user gets 3 votes per event to distribute across topics. Votes don't carry over. No automated deadline, voting open until Admin finalizes agenda

title: Epic 3: Event Engagement & Capacity
description:
To manage physical space constraints and handle high-demand attendance fairly.

Includes:
- 3.1 RSVP with Capacity Tracking: Registered users can RSVP to events with real-time availability display ("X spots remaining") and toggle between "Attending" and "Not Attending"
- 3.2 FIFO Waiting List: When capacity reached, users can join waitlist. Auto-promotion promotes next person when someone cancels and sends notification

title: Epic 1: Public Presence & Discovery
description:
To communicate the value of the community and maintain a persistent, searchable knowledge base of AI "recipes."

Includes:
- 1.1 Landing Page Discovery: Anonymous users can view a landing page explaining mission, cadence, and format with CTAs for "Join Community" and "Explore Recipes"
- 1.2 The Living Recipe Book: Users can browse past topics formatted as "Recipes" with Handle, Description, and Outcomes. Recipes remain editable by Topic Manager or Admin, with search/filter by keywords or tags

title: Implement Epic 1: Public Presence & Discovery
close_reason: Epic 1 implementation complete. All features working: recipe browsing, search, filtering, CRUD operations, i18n, authorization. 16/16 browsing tests passing. See full summary in comments.

title: CSS rendering in html on jam session detail page
description:
bug: CSS rendering in html on jam session detail page
.rounded-full.transform.rotate-2 = l(@jam_session.held_on, format: :long)
close_reason: Fixed Slim CSS rendering - used explicit class= syntax for bracket notation
